question_context.question_text: ¿Los saltos en la cadena causal de la paz son proporcionales (ej. un acto de memoria no genera por sí solo 'reconciliación total')?

patterns.pattern: salto lógico|brecha en la argumentación|milagro de implementación
es realista esperar que|es factible que
la escala de la intervención es coherente con la ambición del resultado
se requieren pasos intermedios para la reconciliación
el resultado es de mayor alcance que el producto

template.title: ## Análisis Q177 (D6-Q2): ¿Los saltos en la cadena causal de la paz son proporcionales (ej. un acto de memoria no genera por sí solo 'reconciliación total')?
template.summary:
### Resumen Ejecutivo

**Área de política**: Derechos de las víctimas y construcción de paz

**Dimensión**: CAUSALIDAD

Se analizó la presencia de **{evidence.elements_found_count}** elementos de evidencia relevantes.

**Puntaje**: {score}/3.0 | **Calidad**: {quality_level}

method_combination_logic.combination_strategy: Bayesian-causal fusion across 7 epistemologically heterogeneous methods. Causal structures are identified, then Bayesian posterior updating quantifies mechanism probabilities and intervention effects. Integration sequence: (1) Primary evidence extraction from source documents; (2) Bayesian probabilistic analysis (4 methods) generates posterior distributions over hypotheses; (3) Structural validation and testing verify internal consistency and external benchmarks; (4) Bayesian-causal synthesis: posterior distributions over causal mechanisms inform final estimates with uncertainty quantification. Data transformations: Bayesian outputs (posterior distributions) → probability mass functions over hypotheses; Semantic outputs (embeddings, classifications) → weighted evidence vectors; Causal outputs (graphs, mechanisms) → validated causal pathway structures. This particularized strategy respects the intrinsic epistemological nature of each method class and ensures authentic intersection of heterogeneous evidence types into a coherent, structured answer for Q177 in PA05/DIM06.
method_combination_logic.rationale: D6-Q2 (Q177) for PA05/DIM06 requires consistent extraction, validation, and synthesis across 7 methods. This block documents how the pipeline combines method outputs into a single evidence product.
method_combination_logic.evidence_fusion: Evidence from all methods is aggregated by the EvidenceNexus according to evidence_assembly. Overlaps are deduplicated where possible and confidence is propagated conservatively.
method_combination_logic.confidence_aggregation: Confidence is aggregated via contract-defined merge strategies, favoring calibrated methods when available.
trade_offs: Coverage vs. cost: using 7 methods increases coverage but raises computation and maintenance burden.
Recall vs. precision: multiple detectors increase recall but can introduce redundancy; deduplication and weighting mitigate this.
Sophistication vs. interpretability: advanced models can be less transparent; human_readable_output documents assumptions and limitations.

traceability.provenance_note: This contract was generated with full multi-method orchestration support. The method_binding.methods array contains all 7 methods from D6_Q2_Executor, and human_answer_structure documents the expected evidence output after execution.

fallback_strategy.note: No fallback strategies enabled. All failures propagate according to error_handling configuration.

calibration.note: Contract does not embed calibration scores. Actual calibration managed via src/farfan_core/core/calibration/ + config/intrinsic_calibration.json + config/fusion_specification.json
